title: jeromanomic
author: jeromanomic
content: I just read this:http://www.finance-guy.net/finblog/how-will-you-spend-your-bitcoin/10/8/2014It raises an interesting point that if we spend Bitcoin to buy stuff, the companies will most likely sell the BTC pretty quickly.What do you think?Will shopping with Bitcoin be good or bad for the price of BTC?

comments.author: Gervais
comments.body: Some people spend, some hodl. What does it matter if they sell it? The money goes back into the system and round and round.

comments.author: Meuh6879
comments.body: I always pay (now) with fiat currency ... so no, i transform in BTC to hold ... but not use (perhaps when my car will fail, i search a car bitcoin seller   they always accept many particulate money when they WANT sell without the old car)

comments.author: guybrushthreepwood
comments.body: Quote from: jeromanomic on August 10, 2014, 11:29:17 AMWill shopping with Bitcoin be good or bad for the price of BTC?How could it possibly be bad. Merchants are what drives adoption. We need people constantly spending their coins to higher the demmand and thus with a limited supply the price will rise.

comments.author: TrailingComet
comments.body: Yes absolutelyI hold 50%, spend the rest and trade stuff to replenish

comments.author: Cranky4u
comments.body: People must use BTC as a transaction (spend) or the entire system freezes up with everyone holding. This would leave bugger all currency floating around, pushing the coins through the roof in price until nobody will swap them for goods because transactions are limited.Moral of the situation, in order for the BTC economy to grow then a reasonable percentage of the BTC economy must be transacted.

comments.author: gtraah
comments.body: When ever I spend I buy the exact amount back.Also It does not matter if they sell right away, someone will always buy it. Eventually when the price is more stable these companies will start to figure that they may as well hold some eventually they may end up holding all, Overstock already holds 10% possibly even more now.And If MANY shops start to accept it. Food, Electronics, Auto industry, Bills (Water, Gas, electricity), Fuel , telephone etc...Eventually they will realise well the price is stable, Millions of merchants are now accepting it & price is slowly on the creep up... this currency is Finite and deflationary.. it will make sense to start keeping 20/30/40/50% or maybe even more... At the end of the day since so many merchants are accepting we can even use it like normal dollars and pay our bills with it or buy stock with it ETCI think we should stop worrying about what companies do with the BTC after we purchase in the long term this is helping this industry and Bitcoin, you can believe that!

comments.author: Baitty
comments.body: I'm forever doing little trades with Bitcoin because I know without trading Bitcoin this revolutionary idea will eventually die people need to trade to make it worth as much as it is.

comments.author: BTCevo
comments.body: I use it mostly for day trading, other than that it has no use to me

comments.author: Baitty
comments.body: Quote from: BTCevo on August 10, 2014, 12:27:15 PMI use it mostly for day trading, other than that it has no use to me  How does it not have any use to you? are you using Bitcoin just to profit in fiat? if so you are doing it wrong and will probably lose out in the long run even if you do profit for a short while.

comments.author: MakeBelieve
comments.body: I mostly purchase small items which are easier to purchase with Bitcoin but because not every place accepts Bitcoin I don't use it for the majority of my purchases.

comments.author: MakeBelieve
comments.body: I can't wait for the day where I'll be able to pay with Bitcoin for my utility bills and grocery bills.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: Yes I spending Bitcoin and don't see what is the problem with this.If nobody spend Bitcoin, for buying digital services and products, merchants will not be interesting to accept bitcopin as additional currency.Trade can just help global popularity of Bitcoin, so it's not wrong to spend it

comments.author: TheGame
comments.body: I've spent a tiny bit and gambled a little bit, but I'd rather save it for a little while as an investment.

comments.author: ensurance982
comments.body: Quote from: jeromanomic on August 10, 2014, 11:29:17 AMI just read this:http://www.finance-guy.net/finblog/how-will-you-spend-your-bitcoin/10/8/2014It raises an interesting point that if we spend Bitcoin to buy stuff, the companies will most likely sell the BTC pretty quickly.What do you think?Will shopping with Bitcoin be good or bad for the price of BTC?Yes of course I spend my Bitcoin. I like the idea of this wonderful currency a lot and I want to spread it even further! I think it is very important to do this! It is true that most companies may sell the BTC directly via BitPay or some other payment processor, yet, there are most likely big whales who buy those BTC instantly, because they're supposed to have contracts with those payment processors, as far as I know. So there's not much pressure on the markets (maybe only a slightly more limited demand)

comments.author: Prez
comments.body: I've spent way more than I should of.If you only hold your coins that real bad imo.

comments.author: Ron~Popeil
comments.body: I use it all the time. Whatever I spend I replace immediately. I take a hit on exchange fees but it is my way of supporting the bit coin economy.

comments.author: ensurance982
comments.body: Quote from: Prez on August 10, 2014, 01:55:09 PMI've spent way more than I should of.If you only hold your coins that real bad imo.Well, why would it be necessarily bad? I can only think of maybe one reason: If you only hold your coins and never spend them, it doesn't even matter how high the BTC price gets, you'll never realize your gains and never profit from the increased price. It doesn't even matter whether you buy something with your coins or just plain and simple sell them, but you need to use them in order to profit from the increased value!
